intro: Gilia liniflora, commonly known as the silky gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically hairy and linear, giving it a distinctive appearance. Gilia liniflora is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
